name: World of Weird Horror: 1980 Quiz | Horror Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what horror movie did magician David Copperfield appear?
questions.explanation:
Terror Train.

	"Terror Train" involved a reunion of students on a train who were getting killed one by one in revenge for a prank that was played years earlier.  Magician David Copperfield played the magician who was hired to entertain, and he was a suspect.  He also did many of the visual effects in the movie.

questions.text: Who loses his head on prom night in "Prom Night"?
questions.explanation:
Lou.

	Nick was about to walk on stage to be crowned king of the prom, but Lou grabbed him and tied him up.  Lou walked out there, unaware that Alex was planning to attack Nick with an ax.  Alex's twin sister had died years earlier because of a prank played by Nick and his friends.  Kim (Jamie Lee Curtis) was Alex's older sister, who was with Nick at the prom.

questions.text: Who picked up the hitchhiker (Jamie Lee Curtis) in "The Fog"?
questions.explanation:
Nick.

	Nick Castle (Tom Atkins) was a truck driver who picked up Elizabeth (Jamie Lee Curtis) who was hitchhiking.  They ended up shrouded with fog containing vengeful ghosts of lepers who died in a sinking ship years earlier. Dr. Phibes was a doctor in the movie, and also the name of a Vincent Price character ("The Abominable Dr. Phibes").

Stanley Kubrick.

	Based on the Stephen King book the movie "The Shining" involved strange visions of a little boy and his father at the Overlook Hotel during a blizzard.  Jack (Jack Nicholson) got a little more crazy as time progressed while he was typing his masterpiece ("All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy").  The mother (Shelley Duvall) didn't seem to notice the visions of dead bodies and strange people until the end of the movie.  Stanley Kubrick was the director.  He directed many interesting movies, including "Dr. Strangelove", "2001: A Space Odyssey", and "Full Metal Jacket".

questions.text: Speaking of "Lolita" what performer from that film appeared in "Alligator"?
questions.explanation:
Sue Lyon.

	Sue Lyon played the NBC newswoman reporting on the destruction caused by a giant alligator in the movie "Alligator", which explored what might have happened if a little girl brought home a baby alligator which her father flushed down the toilet.  Years later, it was still living in the sewer when a chemical company dumped animals which had been used to test a new chemical.  The alligator ate them and grew to gigantic size.  Sue Lyon has appeared in many TV shows and movies over the years, including "Lolita", as Dolores "Lolita" Haze, "The Flim-Flam Man", "Tony Rome", and "Evel Knievel".

questions.text: What performer from "How to Frame a Figg" was a victim at "Motel Hell"?
questions.explanation:
Elaine Joyce.

	Elaine Joyce played as Ema Letha Kusic in "How to Frame a Figg" and Edith Olson, who stayed at Motel Hello in the movie "Motel Hell", where "it takes all kinds of critters to make farmer Vincent fritters", including people.  The movie involved a brother and sister who ran a motel and a sausage factory.  Sometimes they mixed pork with meat from people who stayed at the motel.  Elaine Joyce briefly hosted "The Dating Game" and made guest appearances on shows, such as "The Andy Griffith Show", "Match Game", "Tattletales", and "Green Acres".

questions.text: What performer from "At the Earth's Core" appeared in "Humanoids from the Deep"?
questions.explanation:
Doug McClure.

	Jim Hill (Doug McClure) found out a company, Canco, accidentally created humanoids who were part man and part fish which were killing men and impregnating women.  Doug McClure (May 11, 1935 - Feb 5, 1995) played David Innes in the movie "At the Earth's Core" involving people drilling into the Earth and finding a world of flying reptile people who enslaved savages.  He also appeared in movies, such as "The Land That Time Forgot" and "Cannonball Run II", and TV shows, including "The Virginian" and "Out of This World".

questions.text: What performer from "The Ten Commandments" (1956) went to Egypt again in "The Awakening"?
questions.explanation:
Charlton Heston.

	Based on "The Jewel of the Seven Stars" by Bram Stoker, the film involved Matthew Corbeck (Charlton Heston) finding a mummy of an Egyptian queen.  It so happened his daughter was born at about that time. When she became the same age as the Egyptian queen had been when she died, Matthew's daughter became possessed by the spirit of the dead Egyptian queen. Charlton Heston (Oct 4, 1923 - Apr 5, 2008) appeared in many movies over the years, including "Planet of the Apes", "El Cid", "Soylent Green", "King of Kings", "The Omega Man", and TV shows, including "The Colbys".  Of course, he's famous for playing Moses in "The Ten Commandments".

questions.text: What producer of "Last House on the Left" directed "Friday the 13th"?
questions.explanation:
Sean Cunningham.

	In the busy year of 1980 a little movie appeared called "Friday the 13th" which has grown into a dozen movies (as of 2016) and many products.  The movie involved people getting murdered at Camp Crystal Lake because a boy drowned in the lake years earlier.  It was directed by the producer of "Last House on the Left", Sean Cunningham, who also directed "Deep Star Six", "Spring Break", and "A Stranger is Watching".

questions.text: What performer from "Naked Gun" appeared in "Death Ship"?
questions.explanation:
George Kennedy.

	A black freighter crashed into a cruise ship at night.  Survivors floating on wreckage climbed aboard the freighter the next day, unaware it was the ship that wrecked the cruise ship.  Captain Ashland (George Kennedy) became possessed and started murdering people.  George Kennedy had played Captain Ed Hocken in the "Naked Gun" movies, and appeared in "Airport", "Earthquake", "Charade", and "Cool Hand Luke".
